Source code for src.routes

"""File to handle routes and some exceptions"""
from datetime import timedelta

from fastapi import Request
from fastapi.responses import RedirectResponse
from fastapi_jwt_auth import AuthJWT
from fastapi_jwt_auth.exceptions import AuthJWTException

from .. import app, config
from ..utils.response import Response
from .auth import auth_route
from .company import company_route
from .user import user_route



[docs]@app.exception_handler(AuthJWTException)
def authjwt_exception_handler(request: Request, exc: AuthJWTException):
    return Response.error(
        status_code=exc.status_code,
        content=dict(
            message=exc.message,
        ),
    )




[docs]@app.route("/")
def index(request: Request):
    _url = request.url
    return RedirectResponse(url=f"{_url.scheme}://{_url.hostname}/index.html")



""" @app.middleware("http")
async def before_response(request: Request, call_next, _authorize=AuthJWT()):
    response = await call_next(request)
    if "Bearer" in str(request.headers["authorization"]):
        _token = ""
        try:
            _id = _authorize.get_jwt_subject()
            _token = _authorize.create_refresh_token(
                subject=_id, expires_time=timedelta(minutes=90)
            )
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError)
            _token = ""
        if _token != "":
            response.headers[
                "token" if request.headers["Protected"] else "authorization"
            ] = _token
    return response
"""

app.include_router(auth_route, prefix=config.API_URL)
app.include_router(user_route, prefix=config.API_URL)
app.include_router(company_route, prefix=config.API_URL)
